instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .
definitions.PP5V_S4RS3: What is PP5V_S4RS3? PP5V_S4RS3 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.PP1V05_S0:
What is PP1V05_S0? The PP1V05_S0 power rail is for various components on the logic board that require a 1.05V supply voltage in the S0 (on) state. This voltage rail is likely to be used by the CPU (for VCCIO), PCH (Platform Controller Hub).

.
definitions.PP1V2_S3: What is PP1V2_S3? PP1V2_S3 is a 1.2v power rail present when the machine is in an S3 suspend to RAM state.
definitions.PP1V8_S3: What is PP1V8_S3? The PP1V8_S3 signal in the MacBook schematic is a power rail that provides a voltage of 1.8 volts during the S3 power state. The S3 state, often referred to as "suspend to RAM," is a low-power mode where the computer saves the session's state to RAM, allowing for quicker wake-up times compared to a full shutdown..
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.3V3_SUS: What is 3V3_SUS? 3V3_SUS is an abbreviation for PP3V3_SUS. These are interchangeable. The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .

threads.title: dead 820-000165 air 2017 again...
threads.message:
hi, i have again new board dead. no water damage

Led green, change to orange, but no fan spin. too I check IC <CHIP>U7501</CHIP>, <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> I can't see corrosion

some voltages:

<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> 16.5 V
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.4 V
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 0 V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> 3,3 V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL> 0 V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> 0 V
<SIGNAL>PP1V2_S3</SIGNAL> 0 V
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_S3</SIGNAL> 0V
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0</SIGNAL> 0V
<SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> 0V
<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> 0 V

threads.title: dead 820-000165 air 2017 again...
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 0 V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> 3,3 V"
How is this possible???
Please, post accurate information.

Post <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> basic voltages; pins 1, 2, 3, 9, 12, 13, 14, 15, 17, 19, 20, 27.

threads.title: dead 820-000165 air 2017 again...
threads.message: flip board and I check again 0v but I have broken F7140

threads.title: dead 820-000165 air 2017 again...
threads.message:
<CHIP>U7100</CHIP>

Pin1 = 0v
Pin2 = 16v
Pin3 = 4,3
Pin9 = 0v
Pin12 = 3,3v
Pin13 = 3,3v
Pin14 = 3,3v
Pin15 = 0v
Pin17 = 8,5v
Pin19 = 5v
Pin20 = 5v
Pin27 = 16v

threads.title: dead 820-000165 air 2017 again...
threads.message:
So you have correct <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.
Do you get <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>/SUS now?

threads.title: dead 820-000165 air 2017 again...
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>= 0,52v
<SIGNAL>3V3_SUS</SIGNAL>= 0v

remember I don't have continuity in F7140

thanks friend !

threads.title: dead 820-000165 air 2017 again...
threads.message: i fix fuse and now I have short in <CAPACITOR>C7372</CAPACITOR>

threads.title: dead 820-000165 air 2017 again...
threads.message:
Sorry, I was thinking you've replaced the fuse.
Once <CAPACITOR>C7372</CAPACITOR> is removed, check if fuse is still good.
